newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia shares lift as locals hope for Western bull.
newsitem.headline: Russia shares lift as locals hope for Western bull.

text.p: Domestic demand anticipating a new bull run lifted some leading Russian shares on Wednesday though foreign investors were seen primarily on the sidelines.
"The market is deep and strong," said Deutsche Morgan Grenfell chief trader Pavel Gronbjerg. "While the West is buying a little, selling a little, domestic demand is quite high."
UES shares climbed to $0.1625 at close of the Russian Trading System from $0.1578 at close on Tuesday. Mosenergo rose to $1.440 from $1.435.
MFK-Moscow Partners senior trader Alexei Abdurakhimov said Russian operators were studying Western buying and snapping up shares of UES and other stocks.
"Everybody is waiting for the bull, playing for a rise so they can sell."
He said the local operators could push up prices for another couple of days before their momentum fell and the market corrected.
